intro: Fridericia subexserta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fridericia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, elongated leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
